inlineContent.text: Welcome to the Gnusto Interactive Fiction Engine! Gnusto is a powerful and flexible Swift-based framework designed to help you create rich, dynamic text adventure games. Inspired by the classic Infocom masterpieces, Gnusto provides a modern toolkit that simplifies the development of interactive narratives, allowing you to focus on storytelling and world-building.
Whether you’re a seasoned interactive fiction author or new to the genre, Gnusto offers an approachable yet robust platform for bringing your interactive stories to life.
At its heart, creating a game with Gnusto involves defining your game world, its inhabitants, and the rules that govern their interactions.

content.text: Defining Your World: Locations and Items

inlineContent.text: The foundation of your game is built from

represents a distinct place or room that the player can visit. You define a location with a unique ID, a name, a textual description that sets the scene for the player, and exits that connect it to other locations. The engine’s proxy system provides access to both static properties (defined at creation) and dynamic computed properties (calculated at runtime).
Here’s a simple definition for a cloakroom:

code: The walls of this small room were clearly once lined with hooks,
though now only one remains. The exit is a door to the east.

inlineContent.text: : This is often used as the heading when describing the location.
: The text paints a picture of the location for the player.
, defining how the player can move between locations. The
indicates the room is lit by default, without needing a light source.

is any object, character, or other entity that the player can interact with. Like locations, items have an ID, a name, a description, and various properties that define their behavior and state. Items can represent simple objects, complex devices, NPCs with character sheets, or even abstract concepts through the proxy system.
Let’s add a cloak that the player is wearing, and a brass hook in the cloakroom to hang it on:

code: A handsome cloak, of velvet trimmed with satin, and slightly
spattered with raindrops. Its blackness is so deep that it
almost seems to suck light from the room.

inlineContent.text: : Help describe the item and how the player can refer to it.
, which can be a location, a container item, or the player.
(is it just part of the background?).

content.text: Making it Interactive: Actions and Responses

inlineContent.text: Player commands (like “take cloak”, “attack troll”, or “ask wizard about magic”) are processed by Gnusto’s
objects. These commands are then handled by the appropriate

Gnusto provides 80+ built-in action handlers covering everything from basic movement and object manipulation to complex combat, conversation, and puzzle-solving interactions. You can customize behavior by providing your own handlers or by attaching event handlers directly to items or locations.
might give a dynamic description depending on whether the
is on it. This logic could be placed in an
associated with the hook, or handled through the proxy system’s computed properties for more complex scenarios involving combat state, character interactions, or environmental conditions.
is the central orchestrator of your game. It manages the main game loop, processes player input, updates the
, handles combat and character systems, manages conversations, and interacts with the
to communicate with the player through the centralized

is the single source of truth for everything dynamic in your game world: the player’s current location, the properties and locations of all items, character sheets and combat states, active conversations, timers, game flags, and more. As a game developer, you’ll interact with the
safely through the proxy system and methods provided by the
Creating a game with Gnusto generally follows these steps:
Sketch out your map, puzzles, items, and story.
s using their respective initializers and properties, often organized into logical area groups (enums or structs).
s for unique interactions and puzzle mechanics.
This brings together your areas, vocabulary, and initial game settings.
Gnusto is built with game creators in mind, offering features that simplify development:
The GnustoAutoWiringPlugin eliminates the need to manually create ID constants and wire up game components.
Safe, concurrent access to game state with automatic computation of dynamic properties and validation of state changes.
Create living worlds with state-driven descriptions and behaviors using
80+ built-in action handlers covering everything from basic interactions to complex combat, conversations, and puzzle mechanics.
Full RPG-style combat with character sheets, health/consciousness tracking, combat states, and automated combat resolution.
Rich dialogue mechanics with NPCs, topic tracking, and dynamic conversation flow.
Gnusto’s parser understands natural language, supporting synonyms, adjectives, complex sentence structures, and conversational contexts.
system enables easy translation and customization of all player-facing text.
Easily track and modify game progress, character states, combat conditions, conversations, and timed events through the safe proxy system.
The engine is designed for modularity. Add custom behaviors, new actions, or entire new systems without fighting the core framework.

Gnusto uses a sophisticated proxy system that provides safe, concurrent access to game state while enabling both static and computed properties. Instead of accessing game objects directly, you work with proxy objects that automatically handle state computation and validation.

code: // Access items and locations through proxies
// Proxies provide access to both static and computed properties
let damage = await swordProxy.damage  // Could be static or computed
let isLit = await roomProxy.isLit     // Automatically computed based on light sources
let description = await swordProxy.description  // Dynamic based on current state

inlineContent.text: All state access is thread-safe and respects Swift 6 concurrency
Computed properties are automatically calculated when accessed
State changes flow through proper validation pipelines
Both static (compile-time) and dynamic (runtime) properties work seamlessly
Gnusto includes a comprehensive combat system that handles turn-based combat with multiple participants, weapon systems, and complex combat conditions.

code: // Combat is initiated through standard action handlers

inlineContent.text: Characters in Gnusto are represented by comprehensive character sheets that track health, consciousness, combat abilities, and other vital statistics.
Integration with conversation and combat systems
Rich dialogue mechanics enable complex interactions with NPCs, supporting topic-based conversations, dynamic responses, and conversational context tracking.

code: // NPCs can engage in detailed conversations
// Conversations can branch based on game state, character relationships, and previous interactions

inlineContent.text: based on game state and character relationships
Integration with quest and story systems
supporting both scripted and procedural dialogue
The centralized Messenger system handles all player-facing text, enabling easy localization and consistent tone across your entire game.

code: // All player messages go through the messenger
// Custom games can override messages for their specific tone

inlineContent.text: - translate in one place, works everywhere
- override defaults to match your game’s style
with automatic article handling (“a sword” vs “the sword”)

content.text: Automatic ID Generation and Game Setup

inlineContent.text: One of Gnusto’s most powerful features is the included build tool plugin that automatically discovers your game patterns and generates all the necessary ID constants and game setup code for you.

content.text: What the Plugin Does for You

inlineContent.text: When you include the GnustoAutoWiringPlugin in your game project, it automatically:
definitions and wires them up automatically
: Collects all your items and locations from multiple area files and provides them to your
This means you can focus on writing your game content without worrying about the connection logic!

content.text: Including the Plugin in Your Game

inlineContent.text: To use the GnustoAutoWiringPlugin in your own game project, add it to your
That’s it! The plugin will automatically scan your Swift files during build and generate all the necessary boilerplate code.
If you prefer complete control or want to understand what’s happening under the hood, you can skip the plugin and handle ID generation and game setup manually. Simply don’t include the plugin in your
The choice is yours–use the plugin for convenience, or go manual for complete control.
) for a playable demonstration of Gnusto’s capabilities.
) for a comprehensive example of combat, characters, and complex world interactions.
Dive deeper into specific components like
s, and the new systems by exploring their detailed documentation.
Consult the rest of the documentation for more information on project structure and engine-level concepts.

Action handlers are the core components that process player commands in the Gnusto Interactive Fiction Engine. With 80+ built-in handlers covering everything from basic interactions to combat, conversations, and complex puzzle mechanics, this guide covers the design principles, implementation patterns, and best practices for creating effective action handlers that work with the modern proxy-based architecture.
